summary: On May 4, 2022, homeowners Jeff and Julie Hodges discovered a metal box containing a firearm, unfired cartridges, and other items while gardening. The items were packaged and sent for forensic testing. A forensic report later confirmed that the pistol functioned properly and was test fired to generate a cartridge case for entry into NIBIN. A possible investigative lead was identified linking this case with another from 2002. Unfired cartridges were not examined.
description: Homeowners discovered a buried metal box containing a firearm and other items while gardening. The items were packaged and sent for forensic testing.

evidence.description: Tattered black in color plastic bag
Black in color metal box with latch with interior containing insulated material and cardboard
Black in color Glock 17 pistol, 9x19 mm caliber (serial number obliterated) and unloaded Glock 9mm magazine

test_firing.description: The pistol was test fired to generate cartridge cases.
test_firing.nibin_entry: One (1) test fired cartridge case was entered into NIBIN.

nibin_lead.lead_notes: This is an investigative lead and has not been confirmed.

evidence.description: Seven stray bronze and silver in color 9mm unfired cartridges with Luger headstamp
Small white towel with reddish-brown stains
Black Halloween-type face mask with white eye rings
Black Halloween-type face mask with purple eye rings

generated_evidence.description: Laboratory test cartridge case fired by Glock 17 pistol (BCSO-3)

conclusions: The pistol functions properly and was test fired to generate cartridge cases. One test-fired cartridge case was entered into NIBIN, and a possible investigative lead was identified linking this case to a 2002 case. Unfired cartridges (BCSO-4) were not examined.
